page.title: 12Flooding in Morecambe
page.content: One night in February 1983 the sea came over the promenade and Morecambe was flooded. There was no sea wall up then and all the houses on our road were flooded except for our hotel. My uncle John came in the middle of the night to see if we were alright. We were all asleep but he woke us up by ringing the doorbell . He was wet from head to toe and he stayed for a bit then went home. In the morning some people had cars in their gardens. Lots of cars were ruined because of sea water in their engines and there was no electricity. The next day the wind was still blowing and at high tide the sea was sending high waves over the promenade. A policeman was stopping cars going past Regent Road and he was getting soaked.
